thread.title: Former UNM president signs his New Mexico crime novels
thread.title_full: Former UNM president signs his New Mexico crime novels | Albuquerque Journal News

author: ABQnews Staff
title: Former UNM president signs his New Mexico crime novels
text:
Author and former University of New Mexico president Richard E. Peck signs his New Mexico crime novels “Dead Pawn” and “Jackalope Ca$ino” as well as his collection of newspaper columns, “Traveling at My Desk,” from 1-4 today at Treasure House Books & Gifts, 2012 South Plaza NW in Old Town.
AT BARNES & NOBLE: Albuquerque author S.M. Wilder will sign her book “He Who Lives Within Us” at 2 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, at Barnes & Noble Booksellers, 6600 Menaul NE in Coronado Shopping Center.
Good-looking yet insecure 17-year-old Johnny is moved from his comfortable hometown and school because his parents think he is involved with the wrong crowd. Little do they know, his parents may have made the worst decision of their lives.
AT BOOKWORKS: Richard Melzer signs his “Legendary Locals of Albuquerque” at 3 today at Bookworks, 4012 Rio Grande NW. He follows the many notable men and women who participated in the remarkable grounds of the city from village to town to modern city.
Also today, William Powers talks about and signs his “New Slow City” at 5 p.m. Burned out after years of doing development work around the world, Powers spent a season in a tiny cabin off the grid in North Carolina. Can he live a similarly minimalist life in the heart of New York City?
Sheri Velarde signs “Quest for Redemption” at 7 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13 at Bookworks. Zanna is an elven warrior princess who seems to have it all yet has nothing. Her fate is not her own. Instead it is bound to an ancient magic she has no control over.
Victor Milan will sign “Dinosaur Lords” at 3 p.m. Oct. 18. A world made by the Eight Creators on which to play out their games of passion and power, Paradise is a sprawling, diverse, often brutal place.
AT UNM: Professor Cristobal Valencia will be at the UNM Bookstore, 2301 E. Central, at 2 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12, to sign copies of “We Are the State! Barrio Activism in Venezuela’s Bolivarian Revolution.” It is open to the public. He is an assistant professor in the Department of Anthropology at the University of New Mexico.
